text: Later King Nahash of the Ammonites died and his son succeeded him.

<st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “I will <st data-num="06213" class="">express</st> my <st data-num="02617" class="">loyalty</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05973" class="">to</st> <st data-num="02586" class="">Hanun</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="05176" class="">Nahash</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> his <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">was</st> <st data-num="02617" class="">loyal</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="05973" class="">to</st> me.” So <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> <st data-num="04397" class="">messengers</st> to <st data-num="05162" class="">express</st> his <st data-num="05162" class="">sympathy</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> his <st data-num="01" class="">father’s</st> death.<n id="3" /> When <st data-num="01732" class="">David’s</st> <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st> <st data-num="0935 0413">entered</st> <st data-num="01121 05983">Ammonite</st> <st data-num="0776" class="">territory</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> visit <st data-num="02586" class="">Hanun</st> and <st data-num="05162" class="">express</st> the king’s <st data-num="05162" class="">sympathy</st>,<n id="4" />

the <st data-num="01121 05983">Ammonite</st> <st data-num="08269" class="">officials</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to <st data-num="02586" class="">Hanun</st>, “Do you really <st data-num="05869" class="">think</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> is trying to <st data-num="03513" class="">honor</st> your <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">by</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">sending</st> these messengers to <st data-num="05162" class="">express</st> his <st data-num="05162" class="">sympathy</st>?<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03808" class="">No</st>, his <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st> have <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> you <st data-num="05668" class="">so</st> they can <st data-num="02713 02015">get information</st> and <st data-num="07270" class="">spy out</st> the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st>!”<n id="2" />

So <st data-num="02586" class="">Hanun</st> <st data-num="03947" class="">seized</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David’s</st> <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st> and <st data-num="01548" class="">shaved</st> their beards <st data-num="01548" class="">off</st>.<n id="1" /> He <st data-num="03772" class="">cut off</st> the <st data-num="02677" class="">lower part</st> of their <st data-num="04063" class="">robes</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">so that</st> their <st data-num="04667" class="">buttocks</st> were exposed<n id="2" /> and then <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> them <st data-num="07971" class="">away</st>.

People came and told David what had happened to the men, so he sent messengers to meet them, for the men were thoroughly humiliated. The king said, “Stay in Jericho until your beards grow again; then you may come back.”
When the Ammonites realized that David was disgusted with them, Hanun and the Ammonites sent 1,000 talents of silver to hire chariots and charioteers from Aram Naharaim, Aram Maacah, and Zobah.
They hired 32,000 chariots, along with the king of Maacah and his army, who came and camped in front of Medeba. The Ammonites also assembled from their cities and marched out to do battle.
When David heard the news, he sent Joab and the entire army to meet them.

The <st data-num="01121 05983">Ammonites</st> <st data-num="03318" class="">marched out</st> and were <st data-num="06186" class="">deployed</st> for <st data-num="04421" class="">battle</st> at the <st data-num="06607" class="">entrance</st> to the <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st>, while the <st data-num="04428" class="">kings</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> had <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st> were by <st data-num="0905" class="">themselves</st> in the <st data-num="07704" class="">field</st>.

When <st data-num="03097" class="">Joab</st> <st data-num="07200" class="">saw</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">that</st> the <st data-num="06440 04421">battle</st> would <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">fought</st> on <st data-num="06440 0268">two fronts</st>, he <st data-num="0977" class="">chose</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">some</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel’s</st> <st data-num="0970" class="">best men</st> and <st data-num="06186" class="">deployed</st> them <st data-num="07125" class="">against</st> the <st data-num="0758" class="">Arameans</st>.<n id="1" />

He <st data-num="05414" class="">put</st> his <st data-num="0251" class="">brother</st> <st data-num="052" class="">Abishai</st> <st data-num="03027" class="">in charge of</st> the <st data-num="03499" class="">rest</st> of the <st data-num="05971" class="">army</st>, and they were <st data-num="06186" class="">deployed</st> <st data-num="07125" class="">against</st> the <st data-num="01121 05983">Ammonites</st>.

Joab<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> the <st data-num="0758" class="">Arameans</st> start to <st data-num="02388 04480">overpower</st> me,<n id="2" /> you <st data-num="01961" class="">come</st> to my <st data-num="08668" class="">rescue</st>. <st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> the <st data-num="01121 05983">Ammonites</st> start to <st data-num="02388 04480">overpower</st> you,<n id="3" /> I will <st data-num="03467" class="">come to</st> your <st data-num="03467" class="">rescue</st>.
Be strong! Let’s fight bravely for the sake of our people and the cities of our God! The Lord will do what he decides is best!”

So <st data-num="03097" class="">Joab</st> and <st data-num="0834 05973">his</st> <st data-num="05971" class="">men</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05066" class="">marched</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">toward</st> the <st data-num="0758" class="">Arameans</st> to <st data-num="04421" class="">do battle</st>, and they <st data-num="05127" class="">fled</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">before</st> him.
When the Ammonites saw the Arameans flee, they fled before Joab’s brother Abishai and withdrew into the city. Joab went back to Jerusalem.
When the Arameans realized they had been defeated by Israel, they sent for reinforcements from beyond the Euphrates River, led by Shophach the commanding general of Hadadezer’s army.

When <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> was <st data-num="05046" class="">informed</st>, he <st data-num="0622" class="">gathered</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>, <st data-num="05674" class="">crossed</st> the <st data-num="03383" class="">Jordan</st> River,<n id="1" /> and <st data-num="0935 0413 06186">marched</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">against</st> them.<n id="2" /> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="06186" class="">deployed</st> his army <st data-num="07125" class="">against</st> the <st data-num="0758" class="">Arameans</st> for <st data-num="04421" class="">battle</st> and they <st data-num="03898" class="">fought</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">against</st> him.<n id="3" />

The <st data-num="0758" class="">Arameans</st> <st data-num="05127" class="">fled</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">before</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>. <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="02026" class="">killed</st> <st data-num="07651 0505">7,000</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0758" class="">Aramean</st> <st data-num="07393" class="">charioteers</st> and <st data-num="0705 0505">40,000</st> <st data-num="0376 07273">infantrymen</st>; he also <st data-num="04191" class="">killed</st> <st data-num="07780" class="">Shophach</st><n id="2" /> the <st data-num="06635" class="">commanding</st> <st data-num="08269" class="">general</st>.
When Hadadezer’s subjects saw they were defeated by Israel, they made peace with David and became his subjects. The Arameans were no longer willing to help the Ammonites.
